decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the submitted application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), a final detailed drainage design, including drawings, supporting calculations, SuDS Statement and Drainage Assessment Form shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components must also be submitted to demonstrate how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The system shall be implemented and thereafter managed and maintained in accordance with the approved details. Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site in accordance with policy SI13 of the London Plan 2021, the Sustainable Design and Construction SPG 2014, the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems 2015 and policy DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of any above-ground works, a detailed landscape & planting plan shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The plan shall include, where appropriate, a clear key or legend corresponding to the landscaping plan and providing the following information:- Replanting of lost trees on a ratio of 2 trees planted for each tree lost- Species (both Latin & Common names) for all plants- Locations of all plants or areas of planting- Plant numbers or planting densities- Sizes of all plants and particularly trees 'at time of planting'- Details of all hard-landscaping areas including materials The approved scheme shall then be implemented within the first planting season following substantial completion of the development. The tree planting and landscaping shall thereafter be maintained for five years to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or shrubs which die during this period shall be replaced at the beginning of the following planting season, and the areas shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with Policy G7 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to commencement of development, a scheme to enhance the nature conservation interest of the site shall have been submitted to and agreed in writing by the local planning authority, to include (but not limited to), the enhancements set out in section 3 of the submitted Ecological Review (Furesfen, September 2021). Details to be submitted to include (but not limited to) types and location of bird boxes; locations shown on appropriately scaled maps and plans; monitoring, timetable for implementation, demonstrating that works are aligned with the proposed phasing of construction.The approved scheme shall be implemented in full prior to beneficial occupation of the development.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Notwithstanding the submitted plans and documents, no works or alterations (including brick cleaning) shall be undertaken to the Grade II listed wall without the required listed building consent being granted by the local planning authority.Reason: To prevent harm to the significance of designated heritage assets, in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to its installation, details of any external lighting associated with the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be implemented and maintained in accordance with those details as may be approved. Reason: In the interests of the appearance of the development, nature conservation interests and the amenity of neighbouring properties

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the submitted Arboricultural Method Statement (Wharton, 24 September 2021).The approved measures shall be implemented prior to commencement of any work on site and maintained to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority until the completion of the development.Reason: To safeguard trees worthy of retention and in the interests of the character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy G7 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
description: Proposed hard and soft landscaping works to include recladding of plant/stair-core structure and erection of covered study space structure
